revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Askey |model=RTA1030W |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=08/18/2005 |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=access point,dsl modem |fcc_id=H8N-RTA103XW |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM6348 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand=Spansion |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand=Elpida |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4318 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags=ADSL2+ |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=RTA1030W-XXXXXX |default_ssid_regex=^RTA1030W-[A-F0-9]{6}$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui= |oui_eth= |default_ch= }} "RTA1030W", "41-000170", and "REV1.3" (?) is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
Multiple models are defined by this FCC ID entry... *RTA1030W (USB slave) *RTA1031W (no USB slave)
Appears to have been used by Dynalink / NetComm ([http://bc.whirlpool.net.au/bc/hardware/?action=h_view&model_id=613 whirlpool.net.au entry], [http://www.speedguide.net/routers/netcomm-rta1030w-adsl2-wireless-router-1009 SpeedGuide.net entry]). The BT Voyager 2091 also appears to be this model ([https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=26200 OpenWrt forum thread], [http://www.the-scream.co.uk/forums/t21778.html Random forum post with internal shot showing Askey part number]).
The FCC manual would seem to indicate the SSID follows the pattern of '''RTA1030W-XXXXXX'''. There is WiGLE support for this pattern (OUIs 00:1B:9E and 00:21:63).
